image.altText: Gail Kelsey smiling with a broad brimmed hat on.

props.synopsis: A man who killed his wife at their Logan home more than four years ago told police he'd shot her because she had "just waffled on too much" about his family, a Brisbane jury has heard.

title.children: A man shot his wife dead in Logan after listening to a lengthy 'barrage' about his family, jury hears

image.altText: Smoke rises at various points in the distance, with a smouldering pile of rubble closer in the foreground

props.synopsis: An Australian pilot along with two Papua New Guinean technicians has been freed after they were kidnapped "at gunpoint" from a remote telecommunications site in PNG's highlandsÂ

title.children: Australian pilot freed after being kidnapped 'at gunpoint' in Papua New Guinea's highlands

image.altText: A man in a suit covers his face with a cap and a piece of fabric.

props.synopsis: Shinri Minatoya expressed his profound sorrow to the court over the 2019 deaths of the two Japanese exchange students in his care. No conviction was recorded, but he was ordered to pay a $55,000 fine.

title.children: 'I can't cope': Teacher pleads guilty over drownings of exchange students on K'gari

image.altText: A composite image of murder victims Luke Davies (left) and Jesse Baird

props.synopsis: The area being searched for the bodies of Luke Davies and Jesse Baird is hundreds of kilometres away from the initial search locations in Sydney and Newcastle.

title.children: NSW Police find 'nothing of interest' in second day of Southern Tablelands search for allegedly murdered Sydney couple

image.altText: Several people walk to a submerged car.

props.synopsis: The people of Tully are accustomed to wet weather, but the flooding rains on the weekend still came as a shock.

title.children: Surprise 458mm downpour washes out Australia's wettest town

image.altText: Swimmers at a hinterland waterfall and waterhole.

props.synopsis: A state coroner calls the death of the 13-year-old at a waterhole on the Gold Coast hinterland a "tragic accident", saying if the youth worker had tried to restrain the child the outcome "could have been much worse".

title.children: Inquest finds youth worker was right not to physically restrain boy who drowned while in residential care

image.altText: A saltwater crocodile lying on a muddy riverbank.

props.synopsis: The public is being urged not to feed crocodiles following a string of encounters over the last few months.

title.children: Video of saltwater croc eating shark goes viral as wildlife officers investigate

image.altText: university cap graduation generic

props.synopsis: University students could get cost of living relief in the federal budget, with the education minister considering changes to HECS repayments and unpaid placements.

title.children: Could your student debt be about to change?

image.altText: Varroa mites on honey bee pupae.

props.synopsis: A solitary specimen of Varroa jacobsoni, which is a different species to the pest plaguing New South Wales and Victoria, was found during a routine inspection of a sentinel hive in Brisbane.Â

title.children: Varroa jacobsoni mite detected at the Port of Brisbane

image.altText: Antoinette Lattouf

props.synopsis: Former ABC radio presenter Antoinette Lattouf has escalated her unlawful termination case to the Federal Court, accusing the broadcaster of breaching its own employee agreement by dismissing her without due process.

title.children: Antoinette Lattouf files second legal case against ABC over dismissal

image.altText: Mohammad Shtayyeh's side profile

props.synopsis: Mohammed Shtayyeh says his government is resigning, in a move that could open the door to US-backed reforms in the Palestinian Authority.

title.children: Palestinian prime minister submits government's resignation

image.altText: An aerial view of burnt bushland and houses.

props.synopsis: A cattle farmer who is among a group suing the state-owned company tells the NSW Supreme Court that he repeatedly asked for trees to be cleared ahead of the destructive Tathra bushfire.

title.children: Bushfire victims take Essential Energy to Supreme Court over devastating 2018 bushfire

image.altText: People holding up signs in a protest

props.synopsis: South Korea's government tells young doctors they have until the end of February to return to work or risk being punished for staging a week-long protest that has disrupted services for patients at several major hospitals.

title.children: 'Go back to work, or else': South Korea's striking doctors given ultimatum by government

image.altText: An aerial view of Tuvalu.Â

props.synopsis: An experienced regional diplomat who helped Tuvalu craft the landmark Falepili Union with Australia has been appointed the Pacific nation's new prime minister.

title.children: Pacific nation expected to review security pact with Australia and Taiwan ties after choosing new PM

image.altText: A Malaysian 50 ringgit banknote with a handwritten message on left-hand side in Malay

props.synopsis: A Malaysian woman is reunited with the last bank note given to her by her late father thanks to a social media campaign and a stranger's generosity.

title.children: 'Last money from Dad': Daughter retrieves final bank note gifted from late father after four years

image.altText: Black and white photo of young girl with stern expression holding one hand in her other, with parents smiling either side.

props.synopsis: When Miranda Jakich was 14, her father left her alone in a Russian hospital to have experimental surgery. What she experienced was so traumatic it shaped the rest of her life.

title.children: A belief in Soviet miracles led Miranda's father to send her to Moscow for experimental surgery she never wanted

image.altText: A woman on a stretcher being taken out of a helicopter.

props.synopsis: A woman in her 40s has been taken to hospital following a suspected shark attack near Jurien Bay, north of Perth.

title.children: Woman in critical condition after suspected shark attack near Jurien Bay

image.altText: A graphic image of a serious young man wearing a shirt and tie. Behind him is blue handprints.

props.synopsis: Zachary Rolfe tells a coronial inquest into the 2019 police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker that racist language was "used everywhere" throughout the NT Police Force. WARNING:Â This story contains offensive language.Â

title.children: 'Racist language used everywhere' in NT Police, Rolfe tells inquest

image.altText: A house sits in high flood waters.

props.synopsis: In the lead-up to next month's Brisbane City Council election, the Greens have announced they would ban new developments in certain flood zones in the city â but the idea has been criticised by the LNP and Labor.Â

title.children: Greens push for ban on new developments in Brisbane flood zones in council election promise

image.altText: A man in scrubs stands in a medical room.

props.synopsis: A prominent Brisbane surgeon used a woman in a human trial without her written consent while operating on a hernia that may have never existed, medical board documents reveal.

title.children: Brisbane surgeon found to have used woman in human trial without written consent

image.altText: A young man with dark hair, a beard, a suit and glasses walks on the street.

props.synopsis: A Queensland magistrate has ruled that the complainant who alleges she was raped by Bruce Lehrmann will be cross examined during a committal hearing in June.

title.children: Complainant in Bruce Lehrmann alleged rape case to be cross-examined in Toowoomba

image.altText: Dressed in a dark suit and tie, Barnaby Joyce sits in a room, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Nationals leader David Littleproud says his colleague Barnaby Joyce is on leave after being filmed lying on a Canberra footpath earlier this month.

title.children: Barnaby Joyce takes leave from parliament after encouragement from Nationals leader

image.altText: A man in a suit without a tie stands speaking, gesturing with one hand.

props.synopsis: The Greens say they will not support the government's shared equity housing scheme to pay for up to 40 per cent of a home unless it cuts tax discounts for property investors and does more for renters.

title.children: Greens threaten to sink help-to-buy housing scheme as government resists negative gearing reform

image.altText: A man and a woman walk through a cloud of smoke.

props.synopsis: Hospital staff reported seeing Dougie Hampson "writhing in pain" when he presented to Dubbo Base Hospital, an inquest into his death has heard.

title.children: Inquest hears of 'false diagnosis' of Indigenous man, who died 24 hours after discharge from hospital

image.altText: A group of racing tyres lie on the ground during practice ahead of a race.

props.synopsis: New Zealand motorsport is in mourning after the death of a 15-year-old driver and his 35-year-old co-driver in a crash during a rallysprint event in the country's north.

title.children: 15-year-old driver one of two killed in New Zealand rallysprint driving crash

image.altText: A man in a tracksuit top gets out of a car with 'L' plates on it in a busy street

props.synopsis: A Four Corners and Guardian Australia investigation identifies two men wanted by Rwandan authorities.

title.children: How did a man alleged to have participated in a genocide get citizenship in Australia?

image.altText: a woman wearing a suit looks sideways

props.synopsis: The NSW corruption watchdog's report about former premier Gladys Berejiklian may have been delivered outside its legal authority due to issues around the expiration of an assistant commissioner's term, a Sydney court has heard.

title.children: ICAC report into former premier Gladys Berejiklian potentially not legally valid, civil court hears

image.altText: Aerial image of new housing development in Molonglo Valley

props.synopsis: Some 70,000 people are expected to call the Molonglo Valley home by 2050, and the ACT government wants to recognise it as a new town centre to accommodate the fast growing population.Â

title.children: Canberra is set to gain a sixth town centre â here's what that means

image.altText: a group of male students wearing backpacks walk through a uni campus away from the camera. their faces can't be seen

props.synopsis: The Greens are calling for the government to act quickly to implement recommendations to make university more affordable for students.Â

title.children: Call for government to act on universities review as students 'unable to wait a day longer' amid cost-of-living crisis â as it happened

image.altText: two indigenous women look at camera

props.synopsis: Having lived alongside families impacted by youth crime, Corina James and Roslyn Von Senden were eager to share their perspective with a government inquiry visiting Mount Isa. But their voices weren't heard, leaving them disillusioned and calling for change.

title.children: These women waited for hours to have their say on youth crime, but didn't get the chance to speak

image.altText: Turvey family on holiday

props.synopsis: Mechelle Turvey went through the worst thing a mother can endure. When the senseless death of her 15-year-old son Cassius Turvey ignited fury across the nation, she instead called for peace and unity.

title.children: Mechelle Turvey has had to face the unimaginable as a mother. This is how she copes

image.altText: A group of four girls smile and pose with one hand each in the air. They're all wearing glittery bodysuits or dresses

props.synopsis: For some Taylor Swift fans, securing a coveted ticket to the Australia leg of the superstar's Eras Tour was just the start of their stress â it was time to start curating the perfect concert outfit.

title.children: 'A celebration of girlhood': Why the act of dressing up for Taylor Swift is so layered

image.altText: Nikki Haley walks on stage smiling and waving in South Carolina.

props.synopsis: By staying in a race she has little chance of winning,Â Nikki Haley is doing something very unusual in American politics, but with the leading Republican candidate Donald Trump facing more than 90 criminal charges, these are unusual times, writes Barbara Miller.

title.children: 'I don't think it's far-fetched': The plot twist non-Trump Republicans are hoping Nikki Haley delivers

image.altText: CSIRO research vessel Investigator at sea

props.synopsis: The RV Investigator allows scientists to monitor climate change, map the sea floor and discover new marine species. But a $34 million funding shortfall will see its research operations slashed by a third in the coming years.

title.children: 'A significant loss': Australia's $126m advanced research vessel faces months 'sitting idle' in port
